oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Asymmetric hydrogenation of methyl pyruvate using platinum carbonyl cluster supported on an anion exchanger as the catalyst
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BHADURI, S
LAHIRI, GK
MUNSHI, P
MUKESH, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: enantioselective hydrogenation
alpha-ketoesters
silica europt-1
cinchonidine
complexes
asymmetric
polymer-supported
heterogeneous
hydrogenation
catalysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Anionic platinum carbonyl clusters supported on quaternary amine functionalized cross-linked polystyrene, i.e., anion exchangers, are effective precatalysts for the hydrogenation of methyl pyruvate to methyl lactate. Kinetic data has been obtained for anion exchangers with different quaternary groups. Highest observed rate constant and enantioselectivity are obtained with cinchonine funtionalized resin. The kinetic data also indicates saturation kinetics. The decarbonylated used catalyst could be recarbonylated to give a material spectroscopically (infrared) equivalent to freshly anchored cluster.
